maxpower.kernel.io
Class AspectChangeIO

java.lang.Object
  com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.KernelLib
      maxpower.kernel.io.AspectChangeIO

public class AspectChangeIO
extends com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.KernelLib

A way to create inputs and outputs just like IO, except that you can specify the width of that port and the required aspect change is done inside the kernel, rather than leaving it to the manager.

This can be useful for if you want to save the BRAMs used by the extra FIFO added after the aspect change in the manager, but the far more useful case is when you want to do a non-multiple aspect change, where the manager will do a very inefficient job.

Constructor Detail

AspectChangeIO

public AspectChangeIO(com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.KernelLib owner,
                      int portWidth)
Create an IO port of a given width so that inputs and outputs can be created that handle aspect changes and padding.

Parameters:
owner - The Kernel or KernelLib this is being used in.
portWidth - The width of the port (e.g. 128 for PCIe, or 1536 for LMem).

AspectChangeIO

public AspectChangeIO(com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.KernelLib owner,
                      int portWidth,
                      boolean pushMultiplesToManager)
Create an IO port of a given width so that inputs and outputs can be created that handle aspect changes and padding.

Parameters:
owner - The Kernel or KernelLib this is being used in.
portWidth - The width of the port (e.g. 128 for PCIe, or 1536 for LMem).
pushMultiplesToManager - Push the simple multiple aspect changes into the manager (may help timing on wide ports).

public <T extends com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelObject<T>> T output(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                            com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelType<T> outputType)
Create an output just like io.output, but with the required aspect changes done inside the kernel.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the output (DFEVar, DFEVector, DFEStruct).
Parameters:
name - The name of the output port (how it is referred to in the manager).
outputType - The type of the data you wish to output.
Returns:
A stream that one can connect their output data to.

Create an output just like io.output, but with the required aspect change and padding done inside the kernel.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the output (DFEVar, DFEVector, DFEStruct).
Parameters:
name - The name of the output port (how it is referred to in the manager).
outputType - The type of the data you wish to output.
enable - The enable signal for the output (when the data is valid and you wish to output it).
flush - Output data on this cycle, adding padding if required.
Returns:
A stream that one can connect their output data to.

input

public <T extends com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelObject<T>> T input(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                           com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.KernelType<T> inputType,
                                                                                           com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar enable,
                                                                                           com.maxeler.maxcompiler.v2.kernelcompiler.types.base.DFEVar flush)
Create an input just like io.input, but with the required aspect change and padding removal done inside the kernel.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the input (DFEVar, DFEVector, DFEStruct).
Parameters:
name - The name of the input port (how it is referred to in the manager).
inputType - The type of the input data.
enable - The enable signal for the input (when you are ready to receive more data).
flush - Get new input data from the manager on this cycle, removing padding if required.
Returns:
The input data you asked for.
